intro: Selinum dawsonii, commonly known as Dawson's wormwood, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. It has finely divided, gray-green leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Selinum dawsonii is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species.
